Reviews.Title: DONT FORGET PROGRAMMERS!!!!
Reviews.Author: Manor
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Module expecting it to read the key and configure itself to work with MY car. well it does not work that way. This needs to updated with the Firmware to your specific car. How do you update? you NEED to buy a programmer or go pay $30 in a shop. I bought the programmer and it works great.This Module requires XLOADER 2 (will not work with XLOADER). Only a few wires need to be connected to the car. All the functions work well.

Reviews.Title: Xpressket DB-ALL
Reviews.Author: gevans1
Reviews.Content: Unit works as expected.  Wiring is very easy when used with a Viper 5301, the D2D is the option to use.  Future buyers of this product must be aware that unit must be programmed and this requires either a shop that will do it for you or purchase of the USB adapter.  GM users also need to know exactly which firmware version they are wiring the unit to.

Reviews.Title: Does the job well, but could be better documented
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First, to their credit, their tech support email was great! They answered each question I had quickly and thoroughly!You NEED the XKLOADER2 to program this. If you buy it from some other places they might program it for you, but here you are getting a brand new one with a default firmware for some car. The web site will tell you what car it is.The Python 4203P starter does NOT receive a tach signal from this over the D2D connection. That isn't documented anywhere, and would have saved me a lot of time.The DBALL can "FLASH" the parking lights, but not keep them on in my car. So when the car starts, the parking lights are not on. No biggie, but it wasn't documented either.This unit does provide the brake, tach, parking light (flash) and key bypass for my 2007 Nissan Quest though. That saved me a lot of extra wiring in the car.(The instructions (again, on the web site) say it provides "hood pin" but there IS NO hood pin in my car (as confirmed by the shop manual), so that does have to be installed.)One thing the DBALL DOES do in my car, is briefly interrupt the "auto headlight" signal after the car shuts off. Otherwise they would stay on until the battery dies. This requires extra wiring, but without it, the installation would either prevent me from using the "AUTO" headlight feature, or risk running my battery down. I'm not sure if other bypass modules do this or not.There ARE other bypass module options out there, so do your research.

Reviews.Title: Works like a champ!!
Reviews.Author: Sawdust
Reviews.Content: Very easy plug n play installation. Hardest part was removing the knee bolster. 15 min install time.  Love it :)

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: 79Elci
Reviews.Content: I self-installed this along with a Python 580 remote start system in my '06 Ridgeline using the D2D connection, and it works perfectly.  The instructions were easy to follow, and the system worked the first time; no issues.  Make sure to get the XKLoader 2 along with this module as you must update the firmware before installing it.  The XKLoader is basically a ~$25 USB to CAN interface, but it's necessary in order to program the DBALL.  I had to connect ~12 wires between the Python 580 and the DBALL, and I have a fully functional remote start system.  The Python key fob is able to perform all the same functions as the factor fob, and then some.  The DBALL also does not require you to sacrifice a transponder key to work, which is nice.  I couldn't be happier with how the system functions.

Reviews.Title: Time saver
Reviews.Author: J. Hiatt
Reviews.Content: This is a real time saver if you are using data to data. Only had to connect maybe 8 wires (this was my first alarm install). As noted in another review you will need to buy a xloader (just a glorified USB interface) to update the firmware. No problems thus far and simple to program. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: Works Great, Support SUCKS!!!
Reviews.Author: gregry
Reviews.Content: Unit works awesome and came with some surprise extra functions that were very nice. BUT....... Support absolutely sucks. Here is a sample question and "Complete" answer, copy and pasted from their e-mail.What is the GWR wire?Answer :You need to connect it to either status wire or negative ignition wire(after this answer which made me scratch my head, I had to investigate through a Chevy dealer which told me that GWR means "Ground While Running". If they had just told me this in the answer it would have made it a lot easier and saved me about an hour of time)

Reviews.Title: Way to pricy
Reviews.Author: Esteban A. Valle "--Don't ask what Windows ca...
Reviews.Content: This thing needs to be programmed, which requires of course a special adapter. I guess it's designed to be used by professional installers but still way too pricy.I give it 4 stars because it does integrate well with my wrangler, which saved me a bunch of work installing the viper alarm.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed.
Reviews.Author: Lucas
Reviews.Content: This made installing my viper alarm in my cadillac a piece of cake. This is exactly what you need to have the interface function as it should

Reviews.Title: great item once working
Reviews.Author: Tiger
Reviews.Content: I have done many alarm installs in my life. This items instructions are straight forward. Trouble shooting is a bit uninformed. I have one ignition wire on my 2011 mitsubishi endeavor. I had all power inputs wired in like always in the past. Long story short only hook up what you need, or cat may stay started with key start.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: book crazy
Reviews.Content: The one I ordered was a refurbished one, and the module was just what we needed to set up the car starter.  Worked perfectly, and was much cheaper than buying from another website.

Reviews.Title: Buy the programmer also!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Antonio
Reviews.Content: Great but needs to be programmed buy the suggested 15$ programmer to do this.Also the viper system it links with uses special schematics don't attempt a home install

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Awesome price
Reviews.Author: Sniper
Reviews.Content: Great product..... was simple to use and flash with my vehicle information. Easy to do with the XK Loader2 Xpresskit.

Reviews.Title: Great Data Bypass!! Must have the PROGRAMMER!!!!
Reviews.Author: Howard D.
Reviews.Content: Works great but more geared to the experienced installer and it requires the $25 programmer XK Loader 2  so if your buying the DBALL you must order the loader as well

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Michael F Goulet
Reviews.Content: They always work.  Easy to configure and install.  Small size makes it easy to install virtually anywhere.  Vast number of automobiles supported.

Reviews.Title: Great product! Much lower price!!
Reviews.Author: Shannon Bruch
Reviews.Content: Great product!  Much lower price!  This winter is going to be much easier now that my remote start has been installed

Reviews.Title: Fortin is Better
Reviews.Author: Syed Nadeem Ahmad Bukhari
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get it installed in my 2008 Honda Odyssey Minivan, the installer had to pay $70 to get the online updates. It took more than an hour to download the software update but still no success. Gave up on this and paid another $60 to get iData Bypass instead.

Reviews.Title: Great bypass
Reviews.Author: james778i
Reviews.Content: Shipping was fast and product installed perfect but unit does need to be flashed to work for the car you are installing it in. Will buy from again.

Reviews.Title: Good, though not for unprepared
Reviews.Author: Nathan Moore
Reviews.Content: Just installed this today, so far it's working well. A little difficult to figure out what you need and how to program. For my 2007 Dodge Caliber, I needed this DB-All, an XL202 RF module, a CHTHD2 T-Harness R9, and an XKLoader2 to flash the firmware.I was using the XL202 one-way, which means I only sent signals from my factory key fob to the car and not from the car back to the fob, so I didn't need an antenna. Your needs may vary.On the wiring harness, they have part numbers on their site in the installation manuals. Use the make/model selector and find your installation manual. THOUROUGHLY READ THE MANUAL BEFORE ORDERING ANYTHING! As I said, this is rather tricky, and some models do not have a plug-n-play wiring harness, which would considerably increase installation time. I'm an industrial electrician, and even I didn't want to mess with splicing some 12-odd wires under the dash on my back... I had to check my ignition switch wiring harness inside of my steering column ahead of time to verify that the CHTHD2 would work. Again, do you research, this is not an off-the-cuff project.Directions for flashing the correct firmware to your DB-All are also on their site, along with the free IE add-in to do so. If you have trouble flashing, try setting compatibility mode for IE if you're using a newer version (it's in the troubleshooting guide). I don't think the add-in (XPressVIP 4.5 at time of writing) is compatible with other browsers.Upon installation (follow the directions, and connect wires in proper order), mine did not work. After a little more reading, I had to reset the module and then program again with my factory key. Also, the safety disable toggle switch was in the 'off' position. After this, worked flawlessly. I have yet to hook up parking lights (which have to be run through a relay, I'm assuming because the output of the db-all can't supply enough current for the bulbs without frying). You can buy one cheap at an auto parts store.I spent $100. This is gf's Christmas present, though I gave it to her early; just couldn't wait and it's cold! :) Saved $200 by doing it myself. Spent 6 hours total, but 2/3 of that was reading and research. Actual install only took 20 minutes. Hope this review helps someone else save some time!Edit: I suppose I should mention I'm using this as a remote starter in what Xpress calls RSR (remote start ready) configuration. Works great, and you don't have to sacrifice a key.

Reviews.Title: Easy auto start install
Reviews.Author: RayZ
Reviews.Content: easy way to add remote start to my van! saved me hundreds of $$$$$ and only took 5 minutes to install

Reviews.Title: Most innovative bypass
Reviews.Author: Katano
Reviews.Content: Dei is the best for add on security and convenience. Their dball covers a ton of vehicles and reduces the wiring nightmare of installation. Once I had to reprogram the module after the system became unresponsive after a year of problem free use, but it may not have been due to module's fault. For noobs, go to xpresskit.Com for applications and you will need to get the xkloader (30 dollars on amazon) to program this module for your vehicle.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: The DBALL does exactly as it is supposed to.  As long as I am in range of the factory keyless entry remote, pushing lock 3 times starts the car every time.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: ulisses p.
Reviews.Content: Each remote is set to driver one and driver two so all the preset settings on automatically on when it is started.Great price for an excellent product. Trunk integration is flawless.

Reviews.Title: Worked as almost asexpected.
Reviews.Author: btravis
Reviews.Content: This worked almost as expected. It installed easily per the directions. Very easy setup. I couldn't get the driver's priority to work on a 2012 Civic.

Reviews.Title: WORKS GREAT!!!
Reviews.Author: jruiz_8696
Reviews.Content: my friend who installed an alarm on my truck said that i needed this module so that he didn't have to wire about 20 wires.  just plug and play.  he actually pre-wired it before installing which made it easier on him.

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm!!!!
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: I used this for my Honda Element to hook up a Viper Smart Start alarm and it worked like a charm.... highly recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: E. FISHER
Reviews.Content: I researched and compared this particular alarm component with others on the market before I decided to purchase it and found it to rate very high by several car security magazines.  I received it in new condition as promised by the seller in a very efficient and timely manner.  Awesome!

Reviews.Title: Worked for my application..
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This is a great product, you can use this without giving up a key...  Make sure you check the application for fit to your auto.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Matthew Minnichbach
Reviews.Content: Great bypass unit. works for a lot of cars and plugs right in to my Viper unit D2D. Worth the purchase

Reviews.Title: OK- BUT READ FINE PRINT
Reviews.Author: JL
Reviews.Content: Read the fine print.. what they dont tell you is that this is barely a do it yourself unit! It requires a bunch of set-up!

Reviews.Title: Bypass
Reviews.Author: DeathBySnuSnu
Reviews.Content: Great product. I didn't even know these things existed. Saved me loads of time of wiring the whole car. Looking forward towards any future upgrades to play with.

Reviews.Title: Great possibilities if it would work
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Lets just start with it did not work on my 2005 Dodge Ram though the manual said it did.  After 2 hrs on the phone with Xpresskit (1hr of it on hold) it was determined that they had made a mistake and that the unit is not compatible with my truck.  They also offer no exchange to a unit that would work and I had to buy a different unit.  So because of their poor customer service I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND this product to anyone.Save your money and buy a cheaper unit that works with your car model and don't put your trust on the Xpresskit compatibility chart since apparently they don't check it with the actual vehicles.

Reviews.Title: Did not work for 2005 VW Passat
Reviews.Author: T. Graham
Reviews.Content: The local shop installed my Viper 5704V remote start system and I provided them this device and they wasted over 2 hours trying to get it to work. They called the manufacturer and they admitted that it is using BETA software/firmware!!! We gave up and I had them sell me something that actually worked.What is a company doing shipping a product with a beta/test software????

Reviews.Title: This was a scrapped part.
Reviews.Author: Pam Brady
Reviews.Content: I couldn't get the databus to work, so I took it to Best Buy. Best Buy Technicians confirmed the databus did not work. They showed me the databus would not store data and said the part was listed in their system as 'scrapped'. They asked how I got it. I told them I bought it on Amazon. I bought a new databus from the techs and had them install it.

Reviews.Title: this is for pros only
Reviews.Author: chrisbrian
Reviews.Content: if you dont already have a programmer this is not for you leave it to the pros or complain like a dummy. Again if you cannot get your xkloader2 Within 1 minute this is not for you call a pro he already has one

Reviews.Title: did not work for car
Reviews.Author: bailey
Reviews.Content: listed as a must have for Viper install per their installation 'guides'  Did not in fact need this product.  Check with your local install guys first, don't trust these websites.

Reviews.Title: used
Reviews.Author: unsatisfied
Reviews.Content: Paid for a new item and received a used module i had to unprogram and it had scratches lot of time wasted

Reviews.Title: Trouble loading to computer
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: This item seems to work OK now.  Could not get software to connect using my old XP machine...although instructions say it will.  Once installed on Windows 7 machine I was able to get it to work.  Not great instructions on what options to check/change for specific vehicles.  I guess if you use it regularly you will figure it out but for a first time user it was confusing.

Reviews.Title: must be a dealer to work
Reviews.Author: brian felts
Reviews.Content: had to have a dealer program it cost 300 dollars there is one that does not have to be programed by a dealer it may be better

Reviews.Title: interface module
Reviews.Author: kathy backman
Reviews.Content: this worked great with the starter  i feel this was made extremely well and it was easy to put into the car

Reviews.Title: missing parts
Reviews.Author: dice
Reviews.Content: It was missing a harness out of it but worked fine after I found a harness. Other then that it got here fast and works just didn't have all the parts inculded.

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: Thao Le
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my Nissan Titan on January. When I installed it yesterday I realize I was dead, no light no nothing came up . Unfortunately my is out of return time window so I have to eat it. So if you want to buy this install it when it arrive to avoid eating the dead one like I did.

Reviews.Title: Useless
Reviews.Author: John M. Davis
Reviews.Content: The installed product, while reportedly effective in Jeep products, interferes with the electronics of my 2011 Grand Cherokee; the dash emergency signals were triggered endlessly until the product was disconnected.  My repeated request for software modification have gone unaddressed by the manufacturer.  A waste of effort, time, and money and the disregard by the manufacturer leads me to conclude that they don't care much about customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality control.....
Reviews.Author: SKD
Reviews.Content: The first DBALL I ordered, the harness wouldn't plug into the module...had to send back and order another one, the second one, had poor serial data communications..It wouldn't provide a brake signal to the remote start with the brake pedal applied, and the tach input to the remote start intermittantly allowed the starter to crank longer than it should...I would never recommend buying this product, it doesn't live up to what it claims to do...now I am out $60.00 dollars and alot of time, and my customer isn't happy.....if you want the same result's buy this product....but beware  you've been warned.....

Reviews.Title: REMEMBER YOU WILL HAVE TO PAY A SHOP TO INSTALL AND THE PRICE I GOT WAS OVER $200. CRAP!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Tonya R Martinez
Reviews.Content: this would have been a great product however the remote start I purchased to go with it has to be installed by "an approved shop" and since I have worked for Chrysler for over 10 years and I was going to install this on my wife's Chrysler town and county I wanted to do it my self so it was in fact installed correctly. I have seen many aftermarket products installed over the years and I DO NOT APPROVE of the installation parts they use (quick spices and not solder and heat shrink.) I have returned this and the remote start system and will be looking for one that has better support. no wiring diagrams are offered unless you are a dealer for the company. the brand of the remote start I ought was Viper/Directed I also gave them a horrible review.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: T. Davis
Reviews.Content: This product was not as cheaply made as I first thought. I took it out of the box, which comes with all of the connections needed for your install by the way, and I was amazed at the quality of this little thing. The pictures shown on the site makes this module look bigger than it really is!!! I will recommend to others and will be purchasing another one for my other vehicle!!!

Reviews.Title: Key2Go
Reviews.Author: A. Mui
Reviews.Content: Saw they have the new feature (RSR) that you can use Factory remote to remote start with Car the have push button start (Smart key). After I bought everything and find out it is dealer can only have access for key2Go program function. A $80 remove stater project have become a $200+ paper weight. There are no warning on their website about this, so beware. Amazon should put warning message on the item as Dealer only. And Viper will not give any support to Retail customer. thank you

ProductInfo.Features:
Covers over 95% of cars on the road today
Supports legacy systems like VATS and PASSLOCK
Supports doorlocks and override on cars like Toyota with push-start ignition systems and Chrysler with electronic ignition
ProductInfo.Name: Xpress DBALL Kit Databus all Interface Module
